thread.title: The internet finds a brilliant way to troll Sean Spicer and his green tie
thread.title_full: The internet finds a brilliant way to troll Sean Spicer and his green tie

author: Samantha Scelzo
title: The internet finds a brilliant way to troll Sean Spicer and his green tie
text:
Poor Sean Spicer just cannot catch a break with his fashion choices these days.
First, it was his upside-down House of Cards flag pin , then it was his foot brace with a funky striped sock and now he's at it again with this stained green tie in honor of St. Patrick's Day.
The fact that Sean Spicer gave a press briefing with a stain on his tie fits with literally everything I know about him. pic.twitter.com/Jsl1zrBY0Y
‚Äî Samantha Weiner (@SamanthaWeiner1) March 17, 2017
SEE ALSO: A woman confronted Sean Spicer at an Apple Store and livestreamed the whole thing
The tie, though sloppy, would've been fine if he wasn't on TV giving a press briefing. Meme genius Jesse McLaren took notice of its color and gave Spicer's tie a brilliant, hilarious green screen treatment.
What happens when u wear a green tie on TV üò≠ pic.twitter.com/gAohulqeck
‚Äî Jesse McLaren (@McJesse) March 16, 2017
There's a whole world living in that tie. There's an explosion, some sharks, Jack Nicholson's character in The Shining and even a magical Spiceception.
People of Twitter were quick to applaud McLaren's contribution to the internet community.
@McJesse pic.twitter.com/SBTnEAam7H
‚Äî Lana Berry (@Lana) March 16, 2017
@McJesse You're an artist.
‚Äî Louis Peitzman (@LouisPeitzman) March 16, 2017
@McJesse amazing! pic.twitter.com/CnOqYs0uAq
‚Äî Mike Lopez (@MikeLopez05) March 16, 2017
@McJesse You clever minx! pic.twitter.com/0WScRs7ZJq
‚Äî Listed Monkey King (@VitruvianMonkey) March 16, 2017
@McJesse pic.twitter.com/6wCECWvWDx
‚Äî MissUSWNT‚úäüèª (@MissUSAHockey) March 17, 2017
Inspired by this wizard, another great soul has since come forward to take a crack at the artistry, but this time with Donald Trump's scary "Hotline Bling " moves.
Oh Spicy, haven't you learned? The internet won't let you get away with anything. You meant well, but maybe it's time to hire a stylist.
WATCH: The BBC interview kids just stole the show again
